critique: The document is a formal executive order. It abolishes the Federal Board of Surveys and Maps and transfers its functions to the Director of the Bureau of the Budget. The language is formal and direct, with no explicit emotional expression. Therefore, the initial scores for all emotions are set to 1, indicating a neutral emotional tone. After further consideration, the formal and administrative nature of the document suggests minimal emotional conveyance. The revised scores remain at 1 across all emotions to reflect this neutrality.
